metadata.title: CVE-2022-29581 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - high
metadata.description:
Improper Update of Reference Count vulnerability in net/sched of LinuxKernel allows local attacker to cause privilege escalation to root. Thisissue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.18; version 4.14 and laterversions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29581` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-10.10
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-10.10
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-10.10
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-10.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1001.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
